p: The sesquiterpene Î±-eudesmol has wide interesting bioactivity, such as anticancer, antifeedant, plant growth regulation [ 39], and antimicrobial activity [ 40]. Moreover, Abd El-Gawad et al. [ 41] refered to the allelopathic potential of Rhynchosia minima to the high concentration of eudesmol. In addition, borneol [ 42] and caryophyllene oxide [ 7] were also reported to possess allelopathic activity.
